Draft Rating:

S

Al Attles ranks in the 99th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Attles's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 19 spots higher than they were picked due to his good drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Robert Parish with 8th pick but was worth 3th pick.
  • Drafted Chris Mullin with 7th pick but was worth 4th pick.
  • Drafted Sonny Parker with 17th pick but was worth 6th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Joe Barry Carroll with 1th pick but was worth 47th pick.
  • Drafted Wayne Cooper with 40th pick but was worth 68th pick.
  • Drafted Larry Smith with 24th pick but was worth 57th pick.

Trade Rating:

C

Al Attles ranks in the 50th percentile for trading among executives in our database. That's basically average. It could be worse though lol.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Bernard King to GSW.
  • Lost Wayne Cooper, Ken Green to UTA.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Rickey Brown, Joe Barry Carroll to GSW.
  • Lost Robert Parish, Kevin McHale to BOS.

Signing Rating:

F-

Al Attles ranks in the 2th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Joe Hassett in 1981.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Terry Teagle in 1985.
  • Signed Chuck Aleksinas in 1984.
  • Signed E.C. Coleman in 1977.
